Key Match Events: Tyler O’Neill crushed a three-run homer in the bottom of the 10th to secure a walk-off win over the Baltimore Orioles, 5-3.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Alex Cora expressed optimism about the team's chances in the American League wild-card race despite being four games back with 16 games remaining.
Tyler O’Neill stated that the team needs to focus on themselves and win games rather than worrying about other teams.
Alex Cora acknowledged that O’Neill has been on a tear, hitting 5 homers in his last 5 games and helping the team maintain hope in the wild-card race.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Sox bullpen has struggled, with 19 blown saves since the All-Star break, the most in baseball.
James Paxton, who was sidelined since August due to a calf strain, announced his plans to retire after the 2024 season.
